programme.title: Take a Hike

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: This week, Countryfile heads to Inkberrow in Worcestershire - the village that provided inspiration for Britain's longest-running radio drama, The Archers.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: The team are at Beechgrove planning ahead, with Kirsty and Brian already preparing for a vibrant and fragrant 2026.

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie is in Lairg for the first of the annual autumn lamb sales, and Shahbaz is in Moray to see the aftermath of Scotland's biggest wildfire.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: A feast of food from Freddy Bird, Imad Alarnab, Gemma Ogston and Philip Khoury. Meanwhile, Rick Stein and the Hairy Bikers head out across the UK.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: The bikers continue their culinary journey of British food. The duo explore how our love affair with beer and cider has evolved over centuries.

programme.title: Mary, Queen of Scots
programme.desc: Returning from France to rule Scotland, Mary Stuart gets a grudging welcome, while her cousin in England, Queen Elizabeth, must guard against Mary's rival claim to her own throne.

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Angela Barnes presents an appeal on behalf of Sarcoma UK, a rare cancer charity.

programme.title: World Road Cycling Championships
programme.desc: Jill Douglas presents live coverage of the UCI Road World Championships men's time trial. The world's best compete in Africa for the first time, on a hilly course around Kigali, Rwanda.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Hopetoun House, near Edinburgh. Paul also discovers the architectural history of Hopetoun House.

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael's adventure nears its end on the north Kent coast. In Faversham, he gets out onto the water in the last sailing barge to work on the Thames.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: A kayaker has called a mayday after getting into trouble; although he's able to communicate via his VHF radio, it's a race against time to find him.

programme.title: Living Next Door to Putin
programme.desc: In Estonia, Finland and Norway, Katya meets a beluga whale that may be a Russian spy, and she discovers how saunas are being used in the fight against the enemy.

programme.title: Deep Ocean: Kingdom of the Coelacanth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks into the ocean's depths to discuss the coelacanth, a primeval fish hidden for 400 million years.

programme.title: Rob and Rylan's Passage to India
programme.desc: In Rajasthan, Rob and Rylan try miniature painting and hear an alarming horoscope. Contains some strong language.

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: A repressed and bullied teenager discovers that she has special powers. Horror. Contains some strong language, some violence and some upsetting scenes.

programme.title: Get Out
programme.desc: Chris meets his girlfriend's parents but soon feels something is very, very wrong. Contains very strong language, some violence and some upsetting scenes.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce with a special edition of Question Time during Donald Trump's state visit to the UK. On the panel: Douglas Alexander, James Cleverly, Piers Morgan and Bonnie Greer.

programme.title: Trump and Starmer: The Special Relationship? - Panorama
programme.desc: What is the state of the historic special relationship between the US and the UK.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals continue, with the brief for the six cooks who remain in the competition set by none other than pioneer of molecular gastronomy Heston Blumenthal.

programme.desc: Angela Barnes presents an appeal on behalf of Sarcoma UK, a rare cancer charity.

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Rubble & Crew

programme.title: Pip and Posy

programme.title: The Adventures of Paddington

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are at playgroup when everyone finds out that Mr Bull and Mrs Cow are going to get married the next day.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.desc: When Emmy and Eddie take a joyride. Hurricane Harrigan and Cap'n Turbot get caught water skiing behind the out-of-control boat.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends learn about climbing from Grampy Rabbit at the climbing centre. Mummy Pig is worried about George when he gets scared of heights.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Milkshake! Rosh Hashanah

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo has a change of heart. Harper arcs up at Jo.

programme.desc: Bull helps mount a defense for Taylor's brother-in-law, a prison guard charged with manslaughter for the drowning deaths of two inmates in the middle of a hurricane; Bull aims to convince the jury that his client tried to prevent a "greater harm.".

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull must convince a jury that an alleged murder was actually a tragic accident when TAC represents a woman charged in her 3-year-old stepdaughter's death; Benny gives Bull some surprising news.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: As Bull prepares for fatherhood, his work at TAC suffers without his top attorney Benny, who quit in reaction to Bull's romantic reconnection to Isabella; the team must mount a defense for a young bartender on trial for involuntary manslaughter.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: A charismatic entrepreneur is accused of defrauding investors in her seemingly groundbreaking water filtration company; Bull focuses on selecting jurors whose belief systems allow them to see his client as a dreamer who never meant criminal intent.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Benny's previous career with the district attorney's office comes into focus when Chunk aims to get a new trial for a man he believes was wrongfully convicted of triple homicide by a prosecution team that included Benny.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull helps a famous social media influencer take her father to court to overturn his legal guardianship over her empire, which he was granted after the young mogul suffered a public mental breakdown.

programme.title: Bull

programme.title: Into High Country
programme.desc: Jasons son Dawson and cinematographer, Sam Sarbacher take their biggest pronghorn bucks to date.

programme.title: Elk Camp
programme.desc: Renowned elk caller and professional guide Steve Chappell guides his clients on up close, bugling elk hunts in Arizona and Colorado; Steve's calling skills and capacity for understanding elk behavior are on display each week.

programme.title: Greg McHale's Wild Yukon
programme.desc: Greg and his father go back out in search of moose and memories; will this hunt be triumphant enough for Brent to hang up his hunting gear or will it leave him wanting more?

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve and his buddy Ronny Boehme head to southeast Wyoming, where they shoot clays with Gov. Matt Mead before heading out on a sage grouse hunt.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve hunts Sitka blacktails on Prince of Wales Island in Alaska with his friends Ryan and Mark but ends up with a dinner of fried sea cucumbers.

programme.title: The Western Hunter
programme.desc: Chris Denham continues his quest for mule deer on Wyoming's public lands.

programme.title: Heartland Waterfowl
programme.desc: The crew closes out Canada goose season with Tornado Alley Waterfowl in Kansas; a frigid front pushes in birds; banded honkers; a snowstorm shootout; Joe Palumbo's first-ever Quill goose.

programme.title: Ducks Unlimited
programme.desc: Wade Borne, Jared Brown and Mike Checkett hunt in remote areas.

programme.title: Whitetail Fix
programme.desc: Join the crew on the recap complete with outakes and never-before-seen footage from Season 14.

programme.title: Roger Raglin Outdoors
programme.desc: A variety of hunts.

programme.title: The Wild Outdoors
programme.desc: Hunting and fishing.

programme.title: Inside Outdoors TV
programme.desc: Tim's tormenting hunt for a giant Oklahoma buck.

programme.title: Trijicon's World of Sports Afield
programme.desc: Host Dave Fulson takes a global look at the thrill of bear hunting-featuring multiple species, methods, and landscapes from around the world.

programme.title: Hornady's Dark & Dangerous
programme.desc: Finishing out the season in pursuit of two of Africa's heavyweights: Eland and Elephant Bull.

programme.title: Wardens
programme.desc: Michigan Conservation Officers remove a gill net from Lake Michigan that had been lost and was discovered by recreational divers.

programme.title: Heroes Ranch
programme.desc: Sergeant First Class John Wayne Walding, U.S. Army Green Beret and CEO of Gallantry Global, embarks on a hunt, blending leadership, resilience and adventure.

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: A troubled Gulf War veteran (Denzel Washington) becomes suspicious after a powerful senator's (Meryl Streep) son (Liev Schreiber) becomes a candidate for vice president.

programme.title: Coriolanus
programme.desc: Banished from the city he once served, a former war hero (Ralph Fiennes) joins forces with an old enemy (Gerard Butler) to bring about the downfall of Rome.

programme.title: Bravetown
programme.desc: After an accidental drug overdose, a talented teenage DJ goes to live with his estranged father in a small Army town, where he gets to the bottom of his own pain and learns empathy for others.

programme.title: Disturbing the Peace
programme.desc: A former Texas Ranger with a checkered past is forced to take action when a ruthless biker gang rolls into town looking to cause trouble.

programme.title: Lower Learning
programme.desc: The vice principal (Jason Biggs) of an elementary school rallies the lazy teachers and tries to expose the principal's corruption.

programme.title: Patrick: Evil Awakens
programme.desc: A comatose patient, the subject of a scientist's (Charles Dance) cruel experiments, uses his psychic powers to bring an innocent nurse (Sharni Vinson) under his control.

programme.title: Superbad
programme.desc: Separation anxiety poses a problem for two co-dependent high school seniors who hope to score booze and babes at a party.

programme.title: That's What She Said
programme.desc: In Manhattan, two best friends (Anne Heche, Marcia DeBonis) and their new acquaintance (Alia Shawkat) bond over relationship troubles and an adventure in the city.

programme.title: Booty Call
programme.desc: Two longtime friends hope that lust will prevail during a wild double date, in a humorous look at safe sex.

Adam Lerner has always tried to take good care of his health, so it comes as a cruel surprise when he learns that he has malignant tumors along his spine; his doctor gives him a 50/50 chance of survival.

programme.title: Don't Breathe
programme.desc: Three trapped thieves (Jane Levy, Dylan Minnette, Daniel Zovatto) must fight for their lives after breaking into the home of a blind veteran (Stephen Lang).

programme.title: Don't Breathe 2
programme.desc: Blind veteran Norman Nordstrom has been hiding out for several years in an isolated cabin with a young girl. When a group of unseemly criminals kidnaps her, he's forced to tap into even darker and more creative instincts in an effort to save her.

programme.title: Booty Call
programme.desc: Two longtime friends hope that lust will prevail during a wild double date, in a humorous look at safe sex.

programme.desc: A New Yorker (Michael Biehn) heads to California to find the look-alike brother (James Coburn) of his con-man father.

programme.title: The Last Warrior
programme.desc: A man (Dolph Lundgren) leads earthquake survivors against a gang of violent convicts bent on ruling the world.

programme.title: Wanderlust
programme.desc: Overstressed New Yorkers (Paul Rudd, Jennifer Aniston) think they've found the answer to their problems when they join a counterculture community where the only rule is to be oneself.

programme.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate
programme.desc: A tour of New York City's best eats. Included: Velselka's borscht in the East Village; smoked herring on the Upper West Side; Tasty Hand Pulled Noodles in Chinatown; Cuban grilled corn at Café Habana in SoHo; and Motorino's special round slice of pizza.

programme.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate
programme.desc: Featuring some favorite dishes from the kids' menu; comfort lunch food; and more.

programme.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate
programme.desc: Gino's deep dish pizza, pork rinds at Publica, the Chicago dog at Weiner Circle. and white chocolate are featured.

programme.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate
programme.desc: Featuring food trucks. Jeff Mauro gets happy about an angry lobster sandwich from the Happy Lobster Truck in Chicago.

programme.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate
programme.desc: Barbecue is big in Texas, and North Main BBQ impresses with its well-known brisket. Also featuring fried chicken from Babe's Chicken Dinner House.

programme.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate
programme.desc: We're headed to Atlanta, one of the largest cities in the South, for some of the best things we ever ate. From barbecued rib tips and top-secret burgers, to "angry" mussels that will make your day, we've got the guide to some of Atlanta's most popular places. And what's better than having a local show you around? Atlanta native Alton Brown takes us to some of his favorite spots and lets us in on locals-only secrets.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.desc: Andrew visits the Ozarks, where hunting and fishing are a way of life. During his stay, he eats fried rabbit legs, bear crackling and bacon-wrapped crow breast.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.desc: In New Orleans, Andrew Zimmern samples Cajun comfort foods, like stuffed pig stomach, and classic Creole cuisine, including smoked raccoon.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: From piping-hot fried dumplings and handmade egg noodles to veggie-stuffed flatbread and curried swordfish, Andrew Zimmern showcases the flavourful fusions of the island paradise of Mauritius.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern presents Buffalo's edible icons. From spicy wings and sweet pepperoni pizza to enormous cake donuts and heaping plates of meat and potatoes slathered in sauce.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern looks at the diverse and monumental eats that define Washington, DC. Full of vibrant communities, DC boasts gastronomy that includes local oysters, Ethiopian chicken stew, spicy Chinese stir-fry, and chili-smothered sausages.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern samples some of the best cuisine St. John's, Newfoundland, has to offer. From blue mussels steamed in local beer and creamy cod au gratin to hearty moose stew and savoury rabbit pie, these eats showcase Newfoundland's storied history.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Surfside cuisine is highlighted in San Diego. Laid-back dishes include: Mexican-inspired fish tacos; octopus tostadas; Filipino chicken adobo; So-Cal monster burritos; and a hometown salad.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Host Andrew Zimmern embarks on a culinary exploration of Tokyo, a city known for such edible icons as sushi and tempura.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb follows his nose to Long Island, New York, for an Italian chicken parmesan-pizza hybrid, a twist on a Jewish meat-and-potato tradition, and a 10-scoop battle against the Kitchen Sink Challenge.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey has crossed the country chowing down on some of the best eats American has to offer, and it's time to honor the best of the best by inducting the top five absolute cheesiest dishes in "Man v. Food" history into the Hall of Fame.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb makes his way to Richmond for a lesson on New Zealand-style savory pies, an elevated Jewish deli experience and a towering Ladder Burger Challenge.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb's tasty trek across America brings him to Boulder, Colorado, for a bourbon burger blast, a gooey campfire classic and an insanely hot pizza loaded with three layers of ghost pepper.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: From 2025: Los Angeles Rams at Philadelphia Eagles in an NFC Divisional Round game. The NFC champs from 2021 and 2022 collide just two steps away from another Super Bowl berth, with Sean McVay's Rams sending an improving defense led by Jared Verse against the potent Philly run game orchestrated by Jalen Hurts and anchored by Saquon Barkley. The Eagles had topped L.A. 37-20 on Nov. 24 as Barkley compiled 302 total yards from scrimmage and Matthew Stafford was sacked five times.

programme.title: Carjitsu Championship

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics - the Xs and Os - through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.
